00059 #ifndef HEADER_MD5_H
00060 #define HEADER_MD5_H
00061 
00062 #include <stddef.h>
00063 
00064 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00065 extern "C" {
00066 #endif
00067 
00068 #ifdef OPENSSL_NO_MD5
00069 #error MD5 is disabled.
00070 #endif
00071 
00072 /*
00073  * !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
00074  * ! MD5_LONG has to be at least 32 bits wide. If it's wider, then !
00075  * ! MD5_LONG_LOG2 has to be defined along.                        !
00076  * !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
00077  */
00078 
00079 #if defined(__LP32__)
00080 #define MD5_LONG unsigned long
00081 #elif defined(OPENSSL_SYS_CRAY) || defined(__ILP64__)
00082 #define MD5_LONG unsigned long
00083 #define MD5_LONG_LOG2 3
00084 /*
00085  * _CRAY note. I could declare short, but I have no idea what impact
00086  * does it have on performance on none-T3E machines. I could declare
00087  * int, but at least on C90 sizeof(int) can be chosen at compile time.
00088  * So I've chosen long...
00089  *                                      <appro@fy.chalmers.se>
00090  */
00091 #else
00092 #define MD5_LONG unsigned int
00093 #endif
00094 
00095 #define MD5_CBLOCK      64
00096 #define MD5_LBLOCK      (MD5_CBLOCK/4)
00097 #define MD5_DIGEST_LENGTH 16
00098 
00099 typedef struct MD5state_st
00100         {
00101         MD5_LONG A,B,C,D;
00102         MD5_LONG Nl,Nh;
00103         MD5_LONG data[MD5_LBLOCK];
00104         unsigned int num;
00105         } MD5_CTX;
00106 
00107 int MD5_Init(MD5_CTX *c);
00108 int MD5_Update(MD5_CTX *c, const void *data, size_t len);
00109 int MD5_Final(unsigned char *md, MD5_CTX *c);
00110 unsigned char *MD5(const unsigned char *d, size_t n, unsigned char *md);
00111 void MD5_Transform(MD5_CTX *c, const unsigned char *b);
00112 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00113 }
00114 #endif
00115 
00116 #endif
